Created an attachment (id=54742)
screenshot

shows the duplicate fHistory object, and if I try to expand the one that indicates it has children I get a pile more of the aforementioned errors.
Moving to UI for comment. We don't have steps to reproduce. It looks like a set data callback resulted in an attempt to generate a tree path to an item whose parent was not yet mapped.

I'm not sure whether the duplicate elements and the exception are exactly the same problem. I can reproduce the duplicate entries without an exception.

Steps to reproduce in I20061205-1200 on WinXP:

- new workspace
- paste to Package Explorer:

package p;
import java.util.ArrayList;
public class Struct {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		ArrayList<Integer> list = new ArrayList<Integer>();
		list.add(1);
		list.add(2); //breakpoint
		list.add(3);
	}
}

- set breakpoint
- debug
- in Variables view:
- expand 'list' by clicking on +
- press 'Show Logical Structure'
- expand 'list > [0]' by clicking on +
- press F6
- collape 'list > [0]' by clicking on -
- expand 'list > [0]' by clicking on +
=> 'list > [0]' now has two children with Value 1 (sometimes, the first child has an empty name, and sometimes, it is also called 'value')

Continued steps to reproduce the exception from comment 1:
- collape 'list' by clicking on -
- press F6
- expand 'list' by clicking on +
=> AFEs in log
=> Tree is screwed up (empty rows, content is drawn when row selected, ...)

Raising severity, since this makes serious debugging very hard.

I could not get the error you described Markus, but following your steps up to showing logical structures I can make all of the children of list disappear.

steps: 
1. follow steps in comment 3
2. after I turn on logical structures all of the children of list disappear

the behavior mentioned is not consistent, but after enough toggles of show logical structures it will usually occur

Pretty sure this is a viewer update issue caused by ToggleLogicalStructuresAction, but it does not happen while I am trying to debug, likely because I am causing execution to wait while I'll step allowing any async calls to complete...just a guess though...
I work on a dual processor machine, which could explain why it happens every time for me.
